content.description: A somewhat sandy and flaky 5.8 crack climb.
content.protection: Crash pads, or a rope and rack up to Camalot #4.
content.location: From the Mr. Smiley boulders, head east (as you would for Everything But the Girl) skirting the base of the mountain on your left side. After about 3 minutes, you'll arrive at the mouth of a steep northwest running drainage. The crack will be on your left at the entry of the drainage.

content.description:
Start left at the lower sloper rail and gain the big obvious rail and slopey arÃªte. Move straight up through small edges and slopers. Top out.

 A super clean line with fun, unique movement and aesthetic holds. The crux is moving off the huge rail. Big moves that can feel reachy.

 Definitely worth the approach. Pretty good landing, just don't peel off left too hard.
content.location: Located uphill on the east face of the Mr. Smiley Boulder. The boulder sits above Ash Creek Springs on the south-facing side of Ash Canyon and is recognizable from below as a large white block with a large horizontal crack. See Mr. Smiley Boulders area for detailed approach.

content.description: The Mr. Smiley Boulders sit on the south-facing side of Ash Canyon (north of Calico Basin and west of Kraft Boulders). The area is named for Mr. Smiley V6, an area classic with little traffic due to the approach and secluded position. The area is generally sunny and offers many other quality lines from V0-V4.
